name: Manipulative Narrative Dissection
description: Training in deconstructing and analyzing manipulative narratives used in propaganda, media, and psychological operations.

cards.title: Introduction to Narrative Manipulation
cards.description: Understanding how narratives are constructed to influence beliefs and behaviors.
bulletpoints: Defining manipulative narratives and their function in psychological operations.
Examining real-world examples of narrative control in media and politics.
Identifying common psychological techniques used to frame reality.
cards.summaryText: Define manipulative narratives, study live examples, and catalog framing tricks that steer belief.

cards.title: The Anatomy of a Manipulative Narrative
cards.description: Breaking down the structural elements of persuasive and deceptive storytelling.
bulletpoints: Identifying core components: hero, villain, victim, and savior archetypes.
Recognizing repetition and emotional appeal as persuasive tools.
Understanding how context manipulation alters perception.
cards.summaryText: Dissect archetypes, note emotional repetition, and watch context shifts that twist perception.

cards.title: Framing and Reframing Techniques
cards.description: Examining how narratives are framed to shape public opinion and decision-making.
bulletpoints: Recognizing biased framing in news and social discourse.
Understanding how selective language manipulates perception.
Applying counter-framing techniques to neutralize narrative influence.
cards.summaryText: Spot biased frames, decode selective wording, and counter-frame to reclaim perspective.

cards.title: Cognitive Dissonance & Doublethink
cards.description: Understanding how conflicting narratives create psychological confusion.
bulletpoints: Identifying cognitive dissonance in media and propaganda.
Recognizing ‘doublethink’ and self-contradictory messaging.
Developing strategies to dismantle manipulative contradictions.
cards.summaryText: Call out dissonant storylines, name doublethink, and dismantle contradictions so clarity returns.

cards.title: False Dichotomies and Limited Choices
cards.description: Analyzing how narratives force artificial choices and suppress alternative perspectives.
bulletpoints: Recognizing false binary choices in political and social discourse.
Understanding how forced narratives limit free thought.
Techniques for exposing and countering false dichotomies.
cards.summaryText: Expose forced binaries, expand the option set, and keep thought free from boxed choices.

cards.title: Emotional Manipulation in Narratives
cards.description: Examining how emotional triggers are used to bypass critical thinking.
bulletpoints: Identifying fear-based conditioning in persuasive messaging.
Recognizing guilt, shame, and outrage tactics in propaganda.
Building emotional resilience against narrative coercion.
cards.summaryText: Spot fear, guilt, and outrage hooks, then fortify emotional resilience so logic stays online.

cards.title: Manufactured Consensus & Groupthink
cards.description: Deconstructing how narratives create the illusion of popular support.
bulletpoints: Recognizing the ‘bandwagon effect’ in social movements.
Understanding the role of media amplification in shaping consensus.
Counter-strategies for resisting groupthink influence.
cards.summaryText: Detect bandwagon theatre, audit amplification tactics, and keep independent judgment intact.

cards.title: Selective Omission & Controlled Opposition
cards.description: Unpacking how narratives suppress inconvenient facts and distort reality.
bulletpoints: Identifying key omissions in news reporting and historical accounts.
Recognizing controlled opposition as a narrative containment strategy.
Developing counter-strategies to reveal hidden truths.
cards.summaryText: Hunt for missing facts, unmask controlled opposition, and surface the buried pieces.

cards.title: Reverse Narrative Engineering
cards.description: Reconstructing narratives to reveal hidden agendas and psychological intent.
bulletpoints: Breaking narratives down into their fundamental components.
Tracing narrative origins and identifying vested interests.
Reversing engineered narratives to expose their manipulative core.
cards.summaryText: Deconstruct the plot, trace its architects, and reverse-engineer to expose the agenda.

cards.title: Counter-Narrative Strategies
cards.description: Developing tactics to neutralize and counteract manipulative narratives.
bulletpoints: Building awareness campaigns that expose narrative control.
Using humor and satire as tools to dismantle manipulative messaging.
Strategically crafting alternative narratives to reframe perspectives.
cards.summaryText: Expose control with awareness, weaponize humor, and craft alternate narratives that free perspective.
